Pre-Game Insights: Burundi and Senegal return to action in Group L of the Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers when they square off at the Bingu National Stadium on Monday.
Burundi have now gone four consecutive games without defeat, picking up two wins and two draws.
Senegal were held to a 1-1 draw by Burkina Faso at the Stade Me Abdoulaye Wade.
Senegal have now failed to win three of their last four competitive matches.
Senegal are unbeaten in their last five matches across all competitions, picking up three wins and two draws since January’s AFCON round-of-16 loss against Ivory Coast.
Burundi have lost just one of their last five competitive games while picking up three wins and one draw since June 2023.
